website_summaries.verdict: A revised edition of a cookbook that has a fan-base of dedicated vegetarians who love the distinctive flavors and wide variety of the recipes inside.
pros: This popular vegetarian cookbook has been updated and includes new recipes and vegan dishes along with classic favorites
Teaches techniques that bring out exceptional flavors in a variety of recipes, including vegetarian desserts
Comes in a hardcover edition plus is available on Kindle
cons: Quite a few of the recipes call for eggs, which won't appeal to strict vegetarians or vegans
If you have the original edition, you may find some of the contents repetitive

customer_reviews.title: Great for the guy who needs more vegetables.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an advanced cook. I know a good cookbook when I peruse one. This is clearly written, requires only a modicum of pantry additions, and results in clean, very good tasting meals. It's also an idea book. Recipes are flexible and don't require strict adherence in order to achieve an outstanding dish. You'll learn new techniques and combinations. I'm not a vegan, I'm simply trying to decrease the amount of red meat I eat and become more versatile with that veggie box that gets delivered every week. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: E. Hayner

customer_reviews.title: A Great Cookbook AND a Nicely-Done Kindle E-book
customer_reviews.text: I've used this cookbook for a few years in hardback and it is definitely on my list of desert island cookbooks (assuming said island has good kitchen facilities and a variety of produce). I was concerned however that the Kindle version would be tough to use. No worries. There's both a list at the front of the ebook with all the recipes in page sequence, hotlinked to the recipes, and a complete index, hotlinked to the indexed item in the body of the ebook. Nice job. And the lack of illustration is fine... the book is a fairly compact size.
customer_reviews.author: M. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and easy, this really is the best vegetarian cookbook I've ever found! The recipes are clear and generally don't call for exotic ingredients. The best part is that every dish I've made is flavorful, tasty, yummy! The suggestions for side dishes and adjustments to the recipes are great too. I rely on this cookbook regularly since every recipe has been a winner with my family!
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Casey

customer_reviews.title: No pictures! So not great for gifting.
customer_reviews.text: This is encyclopedia/dictionary ish, without a single photo in the entire book....and that is why I'm returning it. A cookbook without pictures is not worth publishing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Talbott

customer_reviews.title: Great, tasty recipes without any guilt
customer_reviews.text: Great, tasty recipes without any guilt. This has become one of my go-to cookbooks, along with classics like *The Joy of Cooking* and Bittman's *How to Cook Everything.* My family and I use meat sparingly and this book helps me emphasize healthy foods. A big plus: the food is not trendy or fussy, but down-to-earth, real, and satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Always Reading

customer_reviews.title: Binge The Veggies
customer_reviews.text: When middle age forces you to set the ribeyes and head cheese aside (sigh) you can pick up your cookeries and dig into some of the finest vegetarian stylings that will ever dance across your tongue!
customer_reviews.author: Legamin

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for recipes that were a little more common ingredients in my kitchen....not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin

customer_reviews.title: Great for a vegetarian who needs to consider how to feed vegans and carnivores as well
customer_reviews.text: I first checked this out at the library but I liked it so much and it had such great stuff I decided too order pretty quickly. I’ve been vegetarian since I was 11, and been cooking for ages my mom (who happens to be vegan) having taught me since I was little. I think what cinched it for me was it’s organization.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have the original but I like this newer version since it labels each recipe as ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the original but I like this newer version since it labels each recipe as vegan (or not!). Recipes are excellent but like all Deborah Madison books, not every recipe is outstanding. You have to really test drive a recipe to see if you like it.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Happy Eating
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book because I was bored with traditional recipes. This book has great recipes that my entire family are enjoying.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Graham

customer_reviews.title: type too small
customer_reviews.text: Very large and hard to hold book. Print on the book is very, very small....goes into too much detail. I wanted meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner for diabetics. not the book for me
customer_reviews.author: iloveny

customer_reviews.title: I bought it twice!
customer_reviews.text: I have the original hardcover version. This updated one is better and it's great because I can read it on my fire. My Kindle Fire has become my "cookbook" lately. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kat L

customer_reviews.title: There is some really good, useful information in this book
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a Christmas gift. There is some really good, useful information in this book. It's fairly comprehensive, but the recipes themselves aren't very inspiring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value. Highly recommended for anyone.
customer_reviews.text: If you're sick of feeling lethargic after lunch and dinner, or are sick of bland, mediocre salads, get this book. I've only done a handful of recipes so far, but I can tell I will be using this book for a very long time. There are just so many cool recipes in here that everyone will learn more than a few things. I'm not a vegetarian, I just enjoy the health benefits of eating more vegetable-based meals and dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T. Fricke

customer_reviews.title: A go-to in my kitchen and an heirloom quality gift.
customer_reviews.text: I've cooked from the original cookbook for years and recently ordered this as a gift for a young woman moving into her first apartment, to commemorate the months she spent in my kitchen learning to cook and the recipes she loved so much from my cookbook. This is that sort of cookbook...the kind that passes between generations and used consistently. It may not be packed with images, but the writing is terrific and the recipes deliver delicious results for home cooks of every level of skill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A valuable vegetarian resource!
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook has an amazing array of vegetarian recipes and is extremely well organized. I am so impressed with it. I'm glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line Vegetarian Cooking
customer_reviews.text: This is a very gourmet, top of the line, classical French influenced, vegetarian cook book. Every recipe I have used is a five star. Deborah Madison is definitely the Julia Child of vegetarian cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Veggie Nice!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing catalogue of every possible vegetarian dish you can dream up. And when you are stuck on what to make you can discover something new to try. Easy to understand and follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J. McCulloch

customer_reviews.title: A goto source
customer_reviews.text: Some of the recipes require the user to figure out what she means, but she is a pro and learned from the best here in the BAY Area and created her own landmark restaurants. She has packed a lot of knowledge into this volume.
customer_reviews.author: Thought Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. My new favorite cookbook and I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. My new favorite cookbook and I have a lot. Her style and methods are approachable and has helped me progress from cooking by the recipe to understanding the building blocks and ratios of what works in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Russell

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing book. If I could only have one vegetarian ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This is an amazing book. If I could only have one vegetarian cookbook, I would pick this one. Her advice to pick one type of food you love and master it has been extremely helpful to me, a rather poor cook. Her teaching background shines through. This book has made me a better cook!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I do like this cookbook a lot. Sadly, no pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but I returned
customer_reviews.text: Nice book, lovely pictures and concept. many many recipes. I did however return it because the vegetables were mostly common sense old fashioned handed down recipes. I could do them without a book.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Joe

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic update to a classic
customer_reviews.text: Only one member of our family is a true vegetarian, but the original edition of Madison's book is arguably my most prized cookbook, and the one that gets the most use in our house. This update is wonderful. Madison has added quite a bit to the original. I have yet to try most of the new recipes, but I will do my best to cook my way through them. I have given this book to many people over the years as a gift, and I will continue to do so. Bravo, Deborah Madison, and thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I also got one as a gift for one of my kids.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Vernon

customer_reviews.title: A must have for vegetarians!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the 'whys and because' in the introduction of each section of the book. The organisation of the book makes it easy to arrange ingredients. The recipes are a good mix of comfort food and trying something new. I was worried the lack of pictures would make the book hard to get through but I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Miss A Soivimon

customer_reviews.title: beautifully done
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book. The recipes sometimes call for all sorts of ingredients that you might not have but improvising still provides good results. No matter what veggie you found at the farmer's market this book will tell you how to prepare it.
customer_reviews.author: Banjo

customer_reviews.title: As good as all the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. As good as all the other reviews. Already tried two recipes and they were simple, clear and delicious!
customer_reviews.author: ShopperGirl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing amount of information for anyone interested in simple and good meal planning.
customer_reviews.text: Packed with detail and easy to follow. Not just for vegans but a great basic recipes to add to your meal planning.
customer_reviews.author: Youngie

customer_reviews.title: Good cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Bought to try and eat healthier. It's a big book with lots of info and recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Dairy is included in way too many recipes for the book to qualify as vegetarian.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the book because I thought it would be strictly vegetarian. As it turns out, many of the recipes call for dairy. Highly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Roseanna

customer_reviews.title: She loved it and uses it all the time
customer_reviews.text: Gave it as a gift. She loved it and uses it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Schloe

customer_reviews.title: Every recipe is delish
customer_reviews.text: any Thing I make from this book gets enthusiastically devoured by vegetarians and meat eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Keane

customer_reviews.title: better than the first edition
customer_reviews.text: even better than the first edition. good even for an omnivore like me who is trying to more healthy food.
customer_reviews.author: bigmama

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love how Deborah Madison writes with such passion for food. I own many of her books.
customer_reviews.author: Nova Dawn

customer_reviews.title: I love it.  The best from my favorite chef!
customer_reviews.text: My original Vegetarian Cooking for Everyone was totally dog eared and food stained. This new edition is amazing... all my favorites and so much more.
customer_reviews.author: S, de Korte

customer_reviews.title: The best in Vegetarian cooking
customer_reviews.text: Since Greens Resturant I have followed her wonderful recipes and books . She has opened a whole new area in vegetarian cooking .
customer_reviews.author: Sean Sult

customer_reviews.title: Cover torn
customer_reviews.text: Book is fine but giving it as a gift and the cover was ripped ! How embarrassing to give a book with a taped cover. I will have to buy another
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Love how this book breaks down the different vegetables and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love how this book breaks down the different vegetables and gives the best way to use each one. I am not a vegetarian but really enjoy using this book when I see a new vegetable at the farmers market that I want to try.
customer_reviews.author: ACP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Recipes you love to learn, use, and reuse. Madison is a legend :)
customer_reviews.author: LeChef

customer_reviews.title: Not just for Vegans; excellent recipes for vegetarians and other cusines.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a gift. Our daughter loved it and welcomed the varied recipes. Beautiful book with detailed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Hopp

customer_reviews.title: Great book but partly qualifies as an update.
customer_reviews.text: I had the original book and had hoped for many updated recipes and procedures. For this reason I was pretty disappointed However, if you don't own the original I highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Grizelda

customer_reviews.title: We aren't vegetarians but this book was super useful.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted new ideas on how to cook veggies. We aren't vegetarians but this book was super useful.
customer_reviews.author: cboyken1

customer_reviews.title: A favorite cookbook.  Delicious recipes for people who love to cook.
customer_reviews.text: This is my all time favorite cookbook, next to Sally Schneider's "The New Way to Cook". A cookbook I'd be hard pressed to live without. Deborah Madison's orange dressing is a holiday favorite at our Thanksgiving table.
customer_reviews.author: Busygizmo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Paper
customer_reviews.text: Contents seem excellent, but this hardback edition is unfortunately printed on cheap pulpy paper that will suffer from every splash and stain. In a bookstore, I would have put it back on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: macuaig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect1
customer_reviews.text: Every recipe I've tried has been wonderful. I am exceedingly happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel M

customer_reviews.title: My favorite cookbook got even better
customer_reviews.text: Deborah Madison's previous version was the most used cook book I own, in fact I wore it out so I decided to replace it with the new edition. The improvements in the new edition make this an even better book.
customer_reviews.author: mgildea

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great resource for the person who wants to have more vegetables in the diet.
customer_reviews.author: Gardenlily

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Gift for a Vegetarian!
customer_reviews.text: Despite having some shipping issues as this was a gift. My recipient loved it and started making notes of recipes she wanted to try as soon as she got this.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Will Convert Your Non-Vegetarian Friends if Only for a Meal
customer_reviews.text: Gift for a vegetarian friend, but my non-vegetarian husband loves it as well and will tolerate meatless meals with some of these recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: This classic has it all! Walnut bread, made ...
customer_reviews.text: This classic has it all! Walnut bread, made today for a function, was yummy! If I could only have one cookbook, this would be it!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Ferris  Koltun

customer_reviews.title: But a great effort by Madison
customer_reviews.text: Almost too comprehensive. Who can read all this! But a great effort by Madison, nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: DaleC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best cook book I've purchase. The details and description are excellent so is the food.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful and thoroughly useful vegetarian cookbook
customer_reviews.text: The was a great gift to give someone who had the original version. The updates are really great and the new cover is gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Dare I say this is the best vegetarian cookbook in my extensive cookbook collection?!!
customer_reviews.text: Deborah Madison has done it again! Actually she's exceeded my expectations with this revised and updated edition of Vegetarian Cooking for Everyone. She takes vegetarian cooking to a new level, using creativity and leveraging inventive sauces to create recipes that will please vegetarians and vegans, while satisfying omnivores as well. I have many vegetarian cookbooks in my extensive cookbook collection and I think this may be the best. I'm a former vegetarian and current omnivore and Chef. Some Chefs scoff at vegetarian cuisine, but I think it's truly telling when a Chef is able to elevate vegetarian cuisine to make it appeal to the masses. You will not be disappointed with this cookbook, vegan, vegetarian, or omnivore.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Peterson

customer_reviews.title: I like the way it separates the veggies and provides hints ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it separates the veggies and provides hints to get the most from each. There are several vegetables that I am very familiar with but I can now look at them in a bold new way. I was bored with green beans cooked until they were so soft you didn't have to chew but I also didn't like them crunchy as in heated then shocked in cold water, seemed like they were still raw. Now I can add flavors and enjoy my once "raw" beans.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first vegetarian cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, just arrived. Its so nice! and will be given as first cookbook to "beginner vegetarians".
customer_reviews.author: melanie qualls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has lots of good recipes and other information about vegetarian cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and creative
customer_reviews.text: This is a really "user friendly" book. The recipes are straightforward, easy and interesting to read, and the results so far have been very good. The roasted cauliflower is delicious as are the whole wheat and rye rolls. The use of organic vegetables and garnishes enhances the flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: just love healthy & delicious food
customer_reviews.text: Im not a vegetarian, just love healthy & delicious food. So many great recipes. It’s given me ideas and I enjoy using these recipes as a jumping off point, and then adding my own touches. Highly recommend. Especially if you’re tired of the ways you prepare veggies. Most of the recipes are very simple, but she gives tips and provides interesting twists that I’d never have thought of.
customer_reviews.author: J&S

customer_reviews.title: Very informative, interesting recipes.
customer_reviews.text: Well written, interesting book. Great addition to any cookbook library.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B. White

customer_reviews.title: If there's an ingredient that you don't like (for me it's peppers in any form)
customer_reviews.text: Encyclopedic and delightful. The Inclusion of aromatics in nearly every recipe gives real depth to vegetable dishes, making them "main-dish" appropriate. If there's an ingredient that you don't like (for me it's peppers in any form), just leave it out. Other ingredients in these deeply-flavored dishes will fill in for whatever you exclude.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Padgett

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fund-read book even if you don't do any of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fund-read book even if you don't do any of the recipes. The "why" and "wherefores" of ingredients are discussed clearly and informatively. The cooking tips are terrific as they help you learn why certain ingredients and cooking methods work. A great sequel to Madison's earlier work.
customer_reviews.author: SIROCCO

customer_reviews.title: Terrific resource for cooking vegetables
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful resource on cooking vegetables in a healthy and delicious way- not just for vegetarians. One of the best overall resources on cooking I own.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: The new "bible" for vegetarian cooking
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, this IS the new bible for vegetarian cooking! As I begin to harvest many of the fruits and vegetables of this summer, this is my go-to cookbook for new ideas. I have not been disappointed yet. (And, so far, the carnivorous teenagers in my family have not been inclined to complain either). Very, very worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: CalamityJane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a good book, but the original is still my foundation for vegetarian cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Martha A Holland

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Cookbook for Vegetarians and Non-vegetarians
customer_reviews.text: Found a wonderful easy to make red pasta sauce recipe. Look forward to trying more of this great variety of recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: A Must-have Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I am not a vegetarian and I still love this book. There are some adventurous recipes in here but also tons of simple, inventive and delicious stuff to make even the most dedicated carnivore's mouth water. This book should be sitting on everyone's kitchen shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite cookbooks, and the first one I check for ...
customer_reviews.text: Deborah Madison's recipes always have an interesting twist that makes them out of the ordinary. This is to go-to book when I can't decide how to cook a vegetable. I'm not a vegetarian, but her vegetable recipes sell the book. One of my favorite cookbooks, and the first one I check for recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer4321

customer_reviews.title: This is the best cookbook I've seen.
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is the book is too heavy! Great ideas about how to use various foods. I don't follow receipes but like suggestions as to how to go about using various ingredients and combining them.
customer_reviews.author: Laine H. Massey

customer_reviews.title: Great cook book with lots of interesting recipes and information ...
customer_reviews.text: Great cook book with lots of interesting recipes and information to learn for new and longtime vegetarian cooks. Happy to have found this book.
customer_reviews.author: a holl

customer_reviews.title: which I would have liked to have
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece who loves to bake. There are absolutely no pictures, which I would have liked to have.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Covers everything! Great recipes! Love this book, and a great gift! Even for non vegetarians a great book! Get one for you and a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a food enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for a friend who used to be a professional baker and has the enthusiasm for a skills related to delicious food you'd expect. She reports that everything she's made from it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: The book explains a lot of things regarding vegetarian. ...
customer_reviews.text: The book explains a lot of things regarding vegetarian.But egg is not always considered as vegetarian.Most of the recipes contain egg.So if you are an eggless vegetarian, this book is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeyabalan Murugesan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great book. I'm sure it will sell a million copies It is more of a how to cook book
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice update
customer_reviews.text: Here's the update with newer ways of doing things and its' always good to stretch our thinking and make ourselves better.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Get it even if you're a meat lover
customer_reviews.text: Every thing I've tried tastes great and the background information is interesting and entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald G. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Huge resourceful book. Purchased it based on other customers reviews of its value. They were right!
customer_reviews.author: Christine T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Madison hits the mark most if not every time. Roasted tomato sauce recipe worth the price of the book
customer_reviews.author: Ami e. Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book withe some great recipies! Good addition to my knowledge, ability to inspire for new ideas!
customer_reviews.author: Mathias Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: fantastic cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: the book arrived very quickly and in perfect condition and the recipes are fantastic! I've only had it a short time and have loved everything I've cooked.
customer_reviews.author: JWH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for christmad. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for a really filling and savory dishes. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for a really filling and savory dishes. I bought both for my son and his wife. I also lentit out to one of my patients who was sent for counseling to lose weight. He loves it. Mary
customer_reviews.author: mary spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Superb cookbook all around. Well written, easy to follow, wide range of recipes. Highly recommended for novices to advanced cooks.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Smith

customer_reviews.title: She has made some great meals from it
customer_reviews.text: Birthday present for my wife. She has made some great meals from it. It was a hit!
customer_reviews.author: SLG in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Filled with Typos
customer_reviews.text: This dull book is repetitive and RIDDLED with typos, both within the recipes and throughout the index. This coupled with small font and pale printing make for a very aggravating experience when trying to produce a dish or meal.
customer_reviews.author: Susanna

customer_reviews.title: Silly, Silly Me
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are great but honestly I have no idea what I was thinking ordering a cook book for my kindle. That platform is just not suitable for cook books. How am I going to flip through this to find what I want to cook? No idea. Clearly didn't think this the whole way through. If you are going to buy this, and the recipes are certainly worth it, buy the actual book.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This woman knows how to cook-unlike some cookbook cooks. Great ideas-most of her ideas are doable. She also gives simple ways to prepare the vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Rock

customer_reviews.title: No pictures, but...
customer_reviews.text: I was upset that there was no pictures, but it had A TON of amazing recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Another Choice
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my grandson. It weighs more than any other recipe book I've used. There are hundreds of recipes to try before one could reasonably critique the authors cooking skill. However, after skimming the content I also ordered Mark Bittman's latest cookbook for vegans and I think my grandson will find it more useful. The graphics are more appealing for one and Mr. Bittman makes everything he does more interesting. ​
customer_reviews.author: W. K. Macallister

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted one vegetarian cookbook that would cover the gamet of meatless cooking. This was the one. Just like Julia Child and her Mastering French cookbooks, this one will now be my go to vegetarian book.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stillwell

customer_reviews.title: This One Was for My Husband
customer_reviews.text: Haha, when my vegetarian husband retired last year and expressed an interest in cooking, I eagerly bought this book for him, hoping it would engage his interest. However, he has taken on a full-time involvement with music (guitar, singing, tuba) so the book lies unopened on the table in the family room. I skimmed through it and it looks wonderful and I hope that one of these days he'll notice it again and start using it. I'm done with cooking in this lifetime, but if I still enjoyed it, it would be my go-to cookbook, even though I'm not a vegetarian.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle

customer_reviews.title: Deborah Madison has a permanent place on my bookshelf, and this is her best.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not yet used to this version of a wonderful cooking guide. Purchased for a lovely young friend recently married.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Complete Guide
customer_reviews.text: This is a comprehensive guide to everything vegetarian. I now use it as my go-to for every type of vegetable and spices and accompaniments to vegetables. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the cookbook. It has many recipes, and uses a great variety of vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Cabela's Visa

customer_reviews.title: love this!
customer_reviews.text: great book! tons of recipes. simple to complex. a great way to use the veggies in your CSA box! would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Gift for a friend
customer_reviews.text: Since this was a gift for a friend, I have no personal experience with the book. Our friend however, has used several recipes from the book and said they were very good. He is very happy with the book.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Truex

customer_reviews.title: Beans and more beans
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the range of recipes. Expected more creativity, less bean-centric recipes
customer_reviews.author: ed strauss

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my vegan son
customer_reviews.text: He says he likes it. I have no idea what else I might possibly say other than I first read about it in The New Yorker magazine and I thought it sounded like a great idea as a gift for him. Apparently I was correct.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas Trubov

product_meta.title: The New Vegetarian Cooking for Everyone: [A Cookbook]
